news_header: South Africa's budget unveiling postponed due to coalition disagreements over VAT increase amid cost-of-living crisis.
news_original_title: South Africa's finance minister fails to unveil budget after tax row
news_text: South Africa's Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana postponed the national budget unveiling due to coalition disagreements over a proposed VAT increase, which would raise prices during a cost-of-living crisis. This unprecedented delay sent shockwaves through the country, causing the currency to plummet against the US dollar. The opposition criticized the government's indecisiveness, while some coalition partners expressed surprise at the proposed hike. The budget is now set to be presented on March 12.
